member.name: T:CMS.DataEngine.ExtraColumn
member.summary: Defines a column of another object type as a reference (foreign key relationship) pointing to the current object type. Determines how the system handles dependencies for the reference. For example data integrity during import and staging, or cascading deleting when a referenced object is deleted.
member.remarks: Use List collections of ExtraColumn instances to set the property of . Each ExtraColumn in the collection registers a foreign key column of another object type as a reference pointing to the current object type.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ExtraColumn.ColumnName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the foreign key column in the object type that is the source of the reference.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ExtraColumn.ExtendedObjectType
member.summary: Gets or sets the object type that is the source of the reference.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ExtraColumn.DependencyType
member.summary: Determines how the system handles referential integrity and automatic removal of objects when a referenced object is deleted.

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.ExtraColumn.#ctor(System.String,System.String,CMS.DataEngine.ObjectDependencyEnum)
member.summary: Creates a new ExtraColumn instance, defining a reference (foreign key relationship) from another object type to the current object type.
member.param: The object type that is the source of the reference
The name of the foreign key column of the source object type that stores the IDs of the referenced objects
Determines how the system handles referential integrity and automatic removal of objects when a referenced object is deleted (Not required reference by default)

member.name: T:CMS.DataEngine.IMacroProcessingColumnAdapter
member.summary: Represents a column adapter for macro processing that converts the value into a format understandable by macro engine via method (typically, decode or decrypt operation) and converts the text with resolved macros back to the original column format via method (typically a corresponding complementary operation - encode or encrypt).

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.IMacroProcessingColumnAdapter.Preprocess(System.String)
member.summary: Operation that is executed on before the value is processed by macro engine. Typically, decode or decrypt operation.

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.IMacroProcessingColumnAdapter.Postprocess(System.String)
member.summary: A complementary operation to that brings with resolved macros back to the original column format before saving the value back to the object. Typically, encode or encrypt operation.

member.name: T:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings
member.summary: Class representing export/import settings in the type information of objects.
member.remarks: Use in the property of .

member.name: F:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.mLogExport
member.summary: Indicates whether the system logs export tasks when objects of the type are deleted.

member.name: F:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.mLogProgress
member.summary: Indicates whether the import progress log includes a record for objects of the type.

member.name: F:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.mAllowSingleExport
member.summary: Indicates whether the object type supports export of individual objects from UniGrid listing pages.

member.name: F:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.mIncludeToExportParentDataSet
member.summary: Determines how the system includes objects of the type when exporting parent objects.

member.name: F:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.mIncludeToWebTemplateExport
member.summary: Determines the range of objects which will go to the web template export.

member.name: F:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.mWhereCondition
member.summary: Where condition that defines which objects of the type are available for export. Does not affect the single object export.

member.name: F:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.mOrderBy
member.summary: Order by clause that sets the order of objects in the XML data of export packages.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.AllowSingleExport
member.summary: Indicates whether the object type supports export of individual objects from UniGrid listing pages. Default value is true when the object is exportable and logs export tasks, otherwise false.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.LogExport
member.summary: Indicates whether the system logs export tasks when objects of the type are deleted. The delete tasks can be included in export packages. False by default.
member.remarks: When both IsExportable and LogExport are true, SingleObjectExport defaults to true. When set to true, the object type must also provide at least one location in property ObjectTreeLocations.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.LogProgress
member.summary: Indicates whether the import progress log includes a record for objects of the type. True by default.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.IsAutomaticallySelected
member.summary: Indicates whether all objects of the type are automatically selected when creating export packages. For internal objects that are not visible in the object tree. False by default.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.SupportsExport
member.summary: Indicates whether the object type can be exported either through regular Export/Import or through SingleObjectExport.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.IsExportable
member.summary: Indicates whether the object type can be exported through regular Export/Import. False by default.
member.remarks: When both IsExportable and LogExport are true, SingleObjectExport defaults to true. When set to true, the object type must also provide at least one location in property ObjectTreeLocations.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.IncludeToExportParentDataSet
member.summary: Determines how the system includes objects of the type when exporting parent objects.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.IncludeToWebTemplateExport
member.summary: Determines the range of objects which will go to the web template export. If Default, the default selection of objects for web template export is preserved. If None, this object type will never go to web template export. If All, this object type will always go to web template export (both site and global objects). If Site, global objects are excluded. If Global, site objects are excluded.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.ExcludedDependingType
member.summary: Indicates if object is excluded depending type. Default is false.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.WhereCondition
member.summary: Where condition that defines which objects of the type are available for export. Does not affect the single object export.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.OrderBy
member.summary: Order by clause that sets the order of objects in the XML data of export packages. Used to ensure that export packages containing the same objects always have matching XML data.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.ObjectTreeLocations
member.summary: Sets the locations of the object type within the object tree in the export/import wizard.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ImportExportSettings.AlwaysCheckExisting
member.summary: If true, the import process always checks the existing object when importing this object type. Use for object types that may be automatically created by another object type during import, such as automatically created scheduled tasks for recalculation etc.

member.name: T:CMS.DataEngine.MacroProcessingSettings
member.summary: Determines how the system processes macros in the object's fields.
member.remarks: Use in the property of ObjectTypeInfo.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.MacroProcessingSettings.ContainsMacros
member.summary: Indicates whether the object type has fields that can contain macro expressions in their values. Determines if objects are processed when resigning macros in the system. True by default. You can set the value to False to optimize the performance of the resigning process (during manual resigning and upgrades). Does not affect the resolving of macros.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.MacroProcessingSettings.MacroCollectionName
member.summary: Gets or sets name of object collection used for the object type's data in the macro engine. If not set, the is used by default.

remarks.para: Should be set when info object belongs to and has more than 1 .
If is set to 'cms.role' then macro intellisense supplies hint for user as 'Roles' because of method used internally by .
Value of this property is used in Kentico macro engine for acquiring objects of given type, e.g. SiteObjects.Roles or GlobalObjects.Roles.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.MacroProcessingSettings.CheckPermissions
member.summary: Determines whether the system checks read permissions for the given module when accessing objects of the type in the macro engine. True by default. The permissions are checked for the user who saved the macro, not the user viewing the result.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.MacroProcessingSettings.ColumnAdapters
member.summary: Registers column adapters for fields, which value cannot be processed by macro engine right away and requires additional operations (decode, decrypt, etc.).

member.name: T:CMS.DataEngine.ObjectDependency

member.remarks: Use List collections of ObjectDependency instances to set the property of . Each ObjectDependency in the collection registers a foreign key field as a reference pointing from the given object type to another.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ObjectDependency.DependencyType
member.summary: Determines how the system handles referential integrity and automatic removal of objects when a referenced object is deleted.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ObjectDependency.ObjectTypeColumn

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.ObjectDependency.IsDependencyByExtension
member.summary: Returns true when dependency is defined using property. Returns false when dependency is defined using property.

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.ObjectDependency.#ctor(System.String,System.String,CMS.DataEngine.ObjectDependencyEnum,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new ObjectDependency instance, defining a reference (foreign key relationship) from one object type to another.
member.param: The name of the foreign key column that stores the IDs of the referenced objects
The object type that is the target of the reference (null if the target object type is stored in a data column - use the fourth param to specify the field name)
Determines how the system handles referential integrity and automatic removal of objects when a referenced object is deleted (Not required reference by default)
The name of the column that stores the target object type of the reference (null for standard references)

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.ObjectDependency.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,CMS.DataEngine.ObjectDependencyEnum,System.String)

Determines how the system handles referential integrity and automatic removal of objects when a referenced object is deleted (Not required reference by default)
The name of the column that stores the target object type of the reference (null for standard references)

member.summary: Logs synchronization.

member.summary: Parent data inclusion for synchronization.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.SynchronizationSettings.LogSynchronization
member.summary: Determines whether the system logs staging tasks for objects of the type. Select one of the SynchronizationTypeEnum values.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.SynchronizationSettings.ObjectTreeLocations
member.summary: Adds the object type to the object tree on the Objects tab of the Staging application.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.SynchronizationSettings.LogCondition
member.summary: Condition that determines which objects of the given type generate synchronization tasks. If set, only objects that match the condition are synchronized.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.SynchronizationSettings.IncludeToSynchronizationParentDataSet
member.summary: Determines whether the data of parent objects automatically includes child objects of the given type during synchronization (for example staging). Applies to object types that have a parent. Set one of the values from IncludeToParentEnum. The default value is Complete for object types that have the ParentObjectType and ParentID properties set in their type info.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.SynchronizationSettings.ExcludedStagingColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of columns that are excluded when staging objects.
member.remarks: The property does NOT limit the actual data of staging tasks, only the operations that take place on the target server.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.SynchronizationSettings.SupportsTaskOptimization
member.summary: Indicates that objects of given type support staging task logging optimization.
member.remarks: Optimization deletes logged older compatible tasks and is enabled by default.

member.summary: Copies the settings properties to another settings instance

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.MetaFileInfo.InputStream
member.summary: Gets or sets an input stream for loading the binary data of meta file. The loading is performed upon either call or access.

remarks.para: Binary data can be provided either by setting an input stream, or by setting the property. The provided input stream is properly disposed after it is processed (and this property is reset to null).
When meta files are configured to be stored in the file system, a stream-like processing is used (i.e. the binary data is not materialized in memory).

member.name: T:CMS.DataEngine.ObjectDependenciesRemoverConditionHelper
member.summary: Helps to create WHERE conditions.

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.ObjectDependenciesRemoverConditionHelper.GetMultipleSubTrees(CMS.DataEngine.BaseInfo,CMS.DataEngine.IWhereCondition,System.String)

summary.para: Creates where condition for all the children of objects targeted by . The parameter denotes tree structure column. The root objects selected by are not returned.
Creates where condition with semantics as WHERE column IN LIKE (@var + '/%', @var1 + '/%', ...). Enables to filter all children of s within condition by .

member.param: Values from which column of an are needed.
member.example:
Generated condition looks almost like this:
WHERE IN ( (SELECT FROM WHERE ) AS [A] INNER JOIN (SELECT FROM WHERE ) AS [B] ON [A]. LIKE [B]. + '/%'.
A - B -- C
D - E -- F
If the selects A and E then B, C, F is returned.

member.name: T:CMS.DataEngine.DatabaseIDFieldAttribute
member.summary: Specifies to which database column the property maps. Marks this column as an ID column.
member.remarks: Information about ID column is used in unit tests to properly fake given type. Use this attribute to mark an ID column of object with dynamic typeinfo. Objects with fixed typeinfo has this information placed in code and therefore fakes can be initialized without using this attribute. Using this attribute on object with fixed typeinfo overrides ID column information in typeinfo.

member.summary: Indicates whether list represents an empty list with no columns, no matter already existing columns or columns added after
member.remarks: If is explicitly added into an empty list, then this property is true and query does not return any columns only string representation of .

summary.para: There are three possible outputs.
Firstly , there will be no column in query.
Secondly list of columns represented as string, without occurrence of .
Finally , that resolves to * in query.

member.summary: Constructor

member.summary: Creates an empty column list built from the given columns

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.QueryColumnList.AddRangeUniqueColumnsWithAliases(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{CMS.DataEngine.IQueryColumn})
member.summary: Adds unique s with aliases, even though all columns selector was present in the list. Columns without alias won't be added.
member.remarks: Should be used when * is present in the list and user wants to include SQL expression as a column. Column with expression must have an alias or won't be added. If the alias is the same as column name contained in *, then DB exception (Ambiguous column name) may occur, e.g. Select *, X AS DocumentName From CMS_Documents Order By DocumentName.
member.example: { A } is not added. { A AS B } is added. { SUBSTR(A, 0, 5) } is not added. { SUBSTR(A, 0, 5) AS X } is added. { A + A } is not added. { A + A AS X } is added.

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.QueryColumnList.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds one into list, regardless of existing columns. added to the list is created via .

example.para: "A, B, C" will result in exception
"A as B", "A" or "5 as B" are accepted

member.exception: Only one column should be passed as argument

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.DataQueryBase`1.ForEachPage(System.Action{`0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Executes the given action for each page (DataSet) in the results. If the query is not set up as a paged query before calling this method and is not set, executes the action once with the current results.

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.DataQueryBase`1.GetEnumerableResult(System.Data.CommandBehavior,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets an enumeration of data records representing the result of this query.
member.param: Command behavior for the underlying reader.
If true, the underlying reader will be executed using its own dedicated connection.
member.returns: Returns the enumeration resulting from query execution.
member.exception: Thrown when the query does not support reader.
member.remarks: The returned data records can contain additional system columns ( and ) when a paged query is being executed. The columns support the framework infrastructure and should not be relied on in custom code.

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.DataQueryBase`1.GetEnumerableResultAsync(System.Data.CommandBehavior,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Threading.CancellationToken})
member.summary: Asynchronously gets an enumeration of data records representing the result of this query.
member.param: Command behavior for the underlying reader.
If true, the underlying reader will be executed using its own dedicated connection.
member.returns: Returns a task returning the enumeration resulting from query execution.
member.exception: Thrown when the query does not support reader.
member.remarks: The returned data records can contain additional system columns ( and ) when a paged query is being executed. The columns support the framework infrastructure and should not be relied on in custom code.

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.DataQueryBase`1.ExecuteReader(System.Data.CommandBehavior,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes the current query and returns it's results as an . The flag indicates whether this operation is supported.
member.param: If true, the reader will be executed using its own dedicated connection.
member.returns: Returns the data reader resulting from query execution, or null.

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.DataQuerySettingsBase`1.PagedBy(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets up the query as a paged query with the given page size. Resets the page index to first page. Use in combination with NextPageAvailable and NextPage to iterate over the data in batches.
member.remarks: Note that if you iterate the results after calling this method, the results will cover only a single page. To iterate through all items page-by-page, use methods ForEachRow or ForEachObject.

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.DataQuerySettingsBase`1.NotPaged
member.summary: Sets up the query to become not paged query and output all results at once.

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.DataQuerySettingsBase`1.NextPage
member.summary: Adjusts the query to a next page, using the current page size. Use in combination with PagedBy and NextPageAvailable to iterate over the data in batches.
member.remarks: Number of records in one page can be specified by setting MaxRecords property or calling PagedBy() method.

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.IDataQuerySettings`1.PagedBy(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets up the query as a paged query with the given page size. Resets the page index to first page. Use in combination with NextPageAvailable and NextPage to iterate over the data in batches.
member.remarks: Note that if you iterate the results after calling this method, the results will cover only a single page. To iterate through all items page-by-page, use methods ForEachRow or ForEachObject.

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.IDataQuerySettings`1.NotPaged
member.summary: Sets up the query to become not paged query and output all results at once.

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.IDataQuerySettings`1.NextPage
member.summary: Adjusts the query to a next page, using the current page size. Use in combination with PagedBy and NextPageAvailable to iterate over the data in batches.
member.remarks: Number of records in one page can be specified by setting MaxRecords property or calling PagedBy() method.

member.summary: If set, selects only first top N number of records

member.summary: List of columns used for extra filtering within the query, e.g. "CMS_C, CMS_RN"

member.summary: If true, the query is a sub-query used in another query. This brings certain constraints such as that it cannot use order by or CTE.

member.summary: Indicates that this query is nested within another query as its source. This brings certain constraints such as that is cannot use CTE.

member.summary: If true, paging parameters are moved to the outer query. Default true

member.summary: If true, outer query uses the same DataSet as the inner query to provide the same type of result by default. Default true

member.summary: Defines if type columns should be retrieved. If null, they are included if particular types were explicitly requested.

member.summary: Defines how default query can be used. If null, the default query is forced in case typed columns are explicitly not allowed.

member.summary: Inner queries. Can be used to search for specific query.

member.summary: Inner queries list. Defines order of the queries.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.MultiQueryBase`2.DefaultQuery
member.summary: Default query used by the process when type queries are not used.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.MultiQueryBase`2.UseDefaultQuery
member.summary: Flag indicating if the default query should be forcibly used. Default false. This flag is automatically reverted to false in case initializer of particular type query is used through Type("sometype", q => q.Where(...)).

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.MultiQueryBase`2.UseTypeColumns
member.summary: If true (default), the query uses type columns for the output, otherwise it uses only global columns

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.MultiQueryBase`2.DefaultOrderByType
member.summary: If true, the result is ordered by source type by default, then by source order. If false (default), the result is ordered by the source order, and items from different types may interleave.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.MultiQueryBase`2.UseGlobalWhereOnResult
member.summary: If true, the global where condition from the parent query is used outside the inner queries on the whole result. If false (default), the global where condition is used inside individual inner queries.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.MultiQueryBase`2.SelectResultColumnsList
member.summary: List of columns to use for results, by default returns all columns defined in the inner queries. Example: "DocumentName, DocumentID"

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.MultiQueryBase`2.OrderByResultColumns
member.summary: List of columns for the result order by. If not specified, the result is ordered by sources and global order by.

member.summary: Returns the resulting where condition.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.SelectCondition.IsEmpty
member.summary: Returns true if the selection is empty.

member.name: P:CMS.DataEngine.SelectCondition.InlineLimit
member.summary:
Limit of the number of items for the inline evaluation.
If there are more items than this limit, the where condition is returned in format: ColumnName IN (SELECT * FROM @List)), where @List is of the following SQL user-defined table types: Type_CMS_IntegerTable, Type_CMS_BigIntTable, Type_CMS_StringTable, Type_CMS_GuidTable
Otherwise, inline format is used: ColumnName IN (Value1, Value2, ...)
If set to -1, inline format is always used.
member.remarks: The default value depends on CMSDefaultSQLInlineLimit setting, which has a default value of 1000.

member.summary: Prepares the select condition for specific value types
member.typeparam: Method will prepare the condition over , , or .
member.remarks: Null values are ignored.
member.param: Indicates if the negation should be used in the condition (Column NOT IN (1, 2, 3 ...))
member.remarks: If contains only one item, WhereEquals condition is used
member.exception: Thrown when unsupported value type is used.

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.IWhereCondition.ReturnNoResults
member.summary: Sets the query to return no results. This action is irreversible, once the query is set to return no results it cannot be changed. This method is used by data engine to forbid access to data that are not allowed to be accessed (e.g. license limitations), without notifying the process about the fact.

member.name: T:CMS.DataEngine.WhereCondition
member.summary: Where condition builder

member.name: M:CMS.DataEngine.WhereCondition.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor

remarks.para: Conditions created using the constructor don't contain a data source identifier. Source identifiers are used to determine whether sub queries () are materialized or inserted directly into the parent query. For example, a sub query selecting objects from a separated online marketing database needs to be materialized when the parent query is executed against the main database.
If you know the data type that the new condition works with, create the condition using the method. You can also set the data source manually through the property.
